doc.title: ImageFunction
doc.desc: The ImageFunction class is a class for manipulating images. You cannot create objects from this class.

argitem.name: dst
argitem.desc: Specifies the destination Bitmap object for overlaying.

argitem.name: src
argitem.desc: Specifies the source Bitmap object for overlaying.

argitem.name: A
argitem.desc: Parameter A. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.

argitem.name: B
argitem.desc: Parameter B. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.

argitem.name: C
argitem.desc: Parameter C. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.

argitem.name: D
argitem.desc: Parameter D. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.

argitem.name: E
argitem.desc: Parameter E. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.

argitem.name: F
argitem.desc: Parameter F. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.

argitem.name: srcrect
argitem.desc: Specifies the rectangle to be overlaid as a Rect object in pixels (at the image position of the source Bitmap). If unspecified, the entire image is targeted.

argitem.name: cliprect
argitem.desc: Specifies the clipping rectangle as a Rect object (at the image position of the destination Bitmap). If unspecified, no clipping is performed.

argitem.name: affine
argitem.desc:
Specifies how to handle the following six arguments (parameters A to F). If true is specified, the six parameters are interpreted as follows: A : a of the 2D affine transformation matrix B : b of the 2D affine transformation matrix C : c of the 2D affine transformation matrix D : d of the 2D affine transformation matrix E : tx of the 2D affine transformation matrix F : ty of the 2D affine transformation matrix
Through affine transformation, the source image position (x, y) (where the top-left corner of the source rectangle is (0, 0)) is converted to the destination image position (x', y') by the following formula: x' = a*x + c*y + tx y' = b*x + d*y + ty
If false is specified, the six parameters are interpreted as follows: A : X-coordinate position (x0) of the top-left corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position B : Y-coordinate position (y0) of the top-left corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position C : X-coordinate position (x1) of the top-right corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position D : Y-coordinate position (y1) of the top-right corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position E : X-coordinate position (x2) of the bottom-left corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position F : Y-coordinate position (y2) of the bottom-left corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position
If false is specified, the destination position (x3, y3) corresponding to the bottom-right corner of the source is automatically calculated by the following formula: x3 = x1 - x0 + x2 y3 = y1 - y0 + y2

argitem.name: mode
argitem.desc: Specifies the operation mode. omPsNormal If specified, Photoshop-compatible alpha blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsAdditive If specified, Photoshop-compatible Dodge (Linear) blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsSubtractive If specified, Photoshop-compatible Burn (Linear) blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsMultiplicative If specified, Photoshop-compatible Multiplicative blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsScreen If specified, Photoshop-compatible Screen blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsOverlay If specified, Photoshop-compatible Overlay blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsHardLight If specified, Photoshop-compatible Hard Light blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsSoftLight If specified, Photoshop-compatible Soft Light blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsColorDodge If specified, Photoshop-compatible Color Dodge blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsColorDodge5 If specified, Color Dodge blending compatible with Photoshop version 5.x or lower is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsColorBurn If specified, Photoshop-compatible Color Burn blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsLighten If specified, Photoshop-compatible Lighten blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsDarken If specified, Photoshop-compatible Darken blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsDifference If specified, Photoshop-compatible Difference blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsDifference5 If specified, Difference blending compatible with Photoshop version 5.x or lower is performed (not implemented in the current version). omPsExclusion If specified, Photoshop-compatible Exclusion blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omAdditive If specified, Additive blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omSubtractive If specified, Subtractive blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omMultiplicative If specified, Multiplicative blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omDodge If specified, Dodge blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omDarken If specified, Darken blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omLighten If specified, Lighten blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omScreen If specified, Screen multiplicative blending is performed (not implemented in the current version). omAlpha If specified, alpha blending is performed. omAddAlpha If specified, additive alpha blending is performed. In this case, when face is dfOpaque and hda is false, linear interpolation is possible by specifying stFastLinear for the type argument. omOpaque If specified, the alpha information of src is ignored, and src is always considered completely opaque. In this case, when face is dfOpaque and hda is false, linear interpolation is possible by specifying stFastLinear for the type argument.

argitem.name: face
argitem.desc: Specifies the drawing method. dfAlpha If specified, the image is treated as an image with an alpha channel and drawn. dfAddAlpha If specified, the image is treated as an image with an additive alpha channel and drawn. dfOpaque If specified, the image is treated as completely opaque and drawn.

argitem.name: opa
argitem.desc: Specifies the opacity of the overlay (0 to 255).

argitem.name: type
argitem.desc: Specifies the type of affine transformation. stNearest : Nearest neighbor method is used <
